qas.question: Who invented the movable printing press?
What religious movement was spurred by the invention of the printing press?
Which inventions of the period had a great impact on everyday life?
Which invention with military applications helped bring about the nation state?
Advances in what construction trade helped to increase global navigation?
Who invented the stationary printing press?
What religious movement was halted by the invention of the printing press?
Which inventions of the period had no impact on everyday life?
Which invention with no military applications helped bring about the nation state?
Advances in what construction trade helped to decrease global navigation?

context: Certain technological inventions of the period – whether of Arab or Chinese origin, or unique European innovations – were to have great influence on political and social developments, in particular gunpowder, the printing press and the compass. The introduction of <a3_0><b8_0>gunpowder<b8_0/><a3_0/> to the field of battle affected not only military organisation, but helped advance the nation state. <a0_0><b5_0>Gutenberg<b5_0/><a0_0/>'s movable type printing press made possible not only <a1_0><b6_0>the Reformation<b6_0/><a1_0/>, but also a dissemination of knowledge that would lead to a gradually more egalitarian society. The compass, along with other innovations such as the cross-staff, the mariner's astrolabe, and advances in <a4_0><b9_0>shipbuilding<b9_0/><a4_0/>, enabled the navigation of the World Oceans, and the early phases of colonialism. Other inventions had a greater impact on everyday life, such as <a2_0><b7_0>eyeglasses and the weight-driven clock<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
